snippet: A video showed a lieutenant colonel of the Russian Army taking control of Ukrainian policemen who seized a station in the eastern town of Horlivka, Ukraine.
abstract: Video posted online shows a man wearing an unmarked green uniform who calls to attention a squad of Ukrainian policemen who have just switched over to the pro-Russian side in eastern Ukrainian town of Horlivka; man is one of hundreds of pro-Russian militants who have seized government buildings in eastern Ukraine, but unlike in Crimea, where militants are Russian soldiers, in this region many appear to be locals.
lead_paragraph: A video showed a lieutenant colonel of the Russian Army taking control of Ukrainian policemen who seized a station in the eastern town of Horlivka, Ukraine.

headline.main: In Ukraine’s East, Russians Are Blending Right In
headline.print_headline: In Ukraine’s East, Russians Are Blending Right In
